prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 1
Name: Jinxie Tenma
Description: The maid of Kyubi Manor and a friend of Trucy. She thinks I'm a demon.
Character 2
Name: The Amazing Nine-Tails
Description: A masked wrestler of unknown identity and origin. The nine-tailed cape he sports is the signature piece of his costume.
Character 3
Name: Damian Tenma
Description: Jinxie's father and the mayor of Tenma Town. He was found unconscious at the scene of the crime.
Character 4
Name: Rex Kyubi
Description: The deceased alderman of Nine-Tails Vale. His snow-white hair was particularly striking.
Character 5
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She apparently studied psychology while she was in Europe!
Character 6
Name: Phineas Filch
Description: The caretaker of Kyubi Manor. He says he was guarding the entrance at the time of the murder.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective investigating the murder in Nine-Tails Vale. He's a self-styled champion of justice and keeper of the peace.
Character 8
Name: Florent L'Belle
Description: Mayor Tenma's aide. He was supposedly in the foyer with Filch at the time of the murder.
Character 9
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A brilliant former defense attorney who is supposed to be in retirement...
Character 10
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Yokai Legend Scroll
Description: A scroll depicting the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. The sole document showing what Tenma Taro looks like. It seems those who foolishly choose to depict the demon are cursed.
Evidence 2
Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
Description: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.
Evidence 3
Name: Nine-Tails Flower
Description: A flower found only in Nine-Tails Vale. It boosts Jinxie's courage because it was her mother's favorite.
Evidence 4
Name: Special Edition Paper
Description: A newspaper with a photo of Tenma Taro soaring through the air.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Diagram
Description: A diagram showing the scene of the crime. [caption] At the juncture of the corridor, to the north is a dead end with a phone. To the south is the foyer. To the east is the corridor that leads to the Fox Chamber. There is an airduct connecting that corridor to the Fox Chamber.
Evidence 6
Name: Foyer Diagram
Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.
Evidence 7
Name: Fox and Demon Statue
Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. Wrapped in a large cloth. (2 pages.) A token of goodwill made in secret. Jinxie is now the only one who knows what the original looked like.
Evidence 8
Name: Golden Fur
Description: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood.
Evidence 10
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
Description: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside. A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.
Evidence 11
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
Description: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.
Evidence 12
Name: Jinxie's Statement
Description: Jinxie's eyewitness account of the demon in the hallway near the crime scene. She says it fled toward the foyer.
Evidence 13
Name: TV Listings
Description: Filch's TV program guide. The afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster.
Evidence 14
Name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.
Evidence 15
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.
Evidence 16
Name: Village Superstitions
Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.
Evidence 17
Name: Forbidden Chamber Key
Description: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it. The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.
Apollo:
A key? So, then, the Fox Chamber was locked?
Fulbright:
Yes
Evidence 18
Name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
Description: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.
Evidence 19
Name: Hand Cream
Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.
Evidence 20
Name: Azuki Kozo Figure
Description: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time. A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Tenma Taro's really that little maid gal. Ain't no doubt about it!
Person: Filch
Testimony 1
Testimony: I mean, the Tenma Taro I saw was just a lil' thing 'bout her size!
Person: Filch
Testimony 2
Testimony: But the little runt had a big ol' staff. I seen it when she came into the foyer!
Person: Filch
Testimony 3
Testimony: Betcha she stole it from the Forbidden Chamber after stumbling on the crime scene.
Person: Filch
Testimony 4
Testimony: She was gonna use it to wallop me on account o' my fierce reputation, I just know it!
Person: Filch

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me go through the information step by step.

First, I'll list out the characters, evidence, and testimonies to get a clear picture. The key is to find a pair where one piece of evidence directly contradicts a testimony.

Looking at the evidence, I see several items that might be relevant. Evidence 7 is the Fox and Demon Statue, which was used as a weapon and had the mayor's blood on it. It's mentioned that the weapon was wrapped in a large cloth. Evidence 10 is the Amazing Nine-Tails Mask, which was found with white hair inside. Evidence 14 is the autopsy report stating Kyubi's cause of death was a spear, around 3:20 PM, and he was in a drug-induced slumber.

Now, the testimonies are from Filch, who is the caretaker. Testimony 0 says Filch believes Tenma Taro is a little maid, specifically Jinxie. Testimony 1 adds that the Tenma Taro he saw was about Jinxie's size. Testimony 2 mentions that this figure had a big staff and Filch saw it in the foyer. Testimony 3 suggests she stole something from the Forbidden Chamber after the crime. Testimony 4 implies she intended to attack him with the staff.

Wait, so Filch is saying that Tenma Taro is Jinxie, a little maid, and that she had a big staff, which she used or intended to use against him. But looking at the evidence, specifically Evidence 7, the Fox and Demon Statue was the weapon used, and it was wrapped in a cloth. Also, the autopsy report (Evidence 14) says Kyubi was stabbed with a spear, but the statue was a bludgeon, not a spear. So, if the weapon was the statue, which was a bludgeon, then the cause of death by spear contradicts this.

Wait, no. Let me clarify. The autopsy report says Kyubi was stabbed with a spear, but the Fox and Demon Statue was used to bludgeon the mayor. So, there are two different weapons involved? That might be a contradiction. Alternatively, perhaps the statue was used as a bludgeon, but the actual cause of death was a spear, which wasn't mentioned in the evidence.

Wait, looking back, the crime scene diagram (Evidence 5) shows the Fox Chamber, and the statue was the weapon. But the autopsy says Kyubi was stabbed with a spear. So, if the statue was the bludgeon, then the spear must have been another weapon. But then, who used the spear? Or perhaps the statue was used in a way that caused the stabbing? Hmm, maybe not.

Alternatively, looking at the testimonies, Filch says the Tenma Taro he saw was a little maid with a big staff, which he saw in the foyer. But the evidence says the statue was the weapon used, which was wrapped in cloth. So, if the staff was used, but the evidence says the statue was the weapon, that could be a contradiction.

Wait, no, the statue itself is the weapon, so the staff might refer to the statue. But Filch says the figure had a big staff, which might mean the statue. But then, the evidence says the statue was used as a bludgeon, not a spear. The autopsy report says the cause was a spear. So, perhaps the contradiction is that the testimony says the figure (Jinxie) had a big staff, implying she used it, but the evidence says the statue was the weapon, and the cause of death was a spear, not a bludgeon.

Alternatively, maybe the key point is that the statue was wrapped in cloth, as per Evidence 7, but Filch's testimony says he saw the figure with a big staff in the foyer. So, if the statue was wrapped in cloth, Filch wouldn't have seen the staff unless it was unwrapped. But the evidence says it was wrapped, so Filch's testimony that he saw the staff contradicts the evidence that it was wrapped, hence not visible.

Wait, that's a good point. If the statue was wrapped in a cloth, then Filch wouldn't have seen the staff unless it was unwrapped. But the evidence states it was wrapped, so Filch's testimony that he saw the staff is contradictory.

So, the contradiction is between Evidence 7 (statue wrapped in cloth) and Testimony 2 (Filch saw the staff). Therefore, the pair is Evidence 7 and Testimony 2.
</think>

Testimony 0
Testimony: I was in the hallway, HIDING in the shadows. THAT'S when I heard the confession.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm looking for a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. 

First, I'll go through each piece of evidence and testimony to understand what they're saying.

Looking at the evidence, Evidence 5 is the Crime Scene Diagram. It describes the layout: at the corridor juncture, north is a dead end with a phone, south is the foyer, east leads to the Fox Chamber, and there's an airduct connecting the corridor to the Fox Chamber.

Now, the testimonies are from Florent L'Belle. Testimony 4 says that L'Belle fled down the hallway to his right, which was the one with the phone at the end. 

Wait a minute, according to the Crime Scene Diagram, the hallway with the phone is to the north, which is a dead end. But L'Belle says he fled to his right, which would be the south, leading to the foyer. That's a contradiction because the phone is at the northern end, not the southern.

So, the key point is that the diagram shows the phone at the north end, but L'Belle's testimony places it to his right, which should be the south. This means they contradict each other.
</think>

Testimony 0

Testimony 1

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by carefully reviewing the information provided.

First, looking at the evidence, I see that Evidence 5 is the Crime Scene Diagram. It describes the layout of the crime scene, mentioning that at the juncture of the corridor, to the north is a dead end with a phone, to the south is the foyer, and to the east is the corridor leading to the Fox Chamber. There's also an airduct connecting that corridor to the Fox Chamber.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Testimony 4 from L'Belle states: "The yokai feathers and tracks weren't there before the Fox Chamber was opened." This suggests that the feathers and tracks appeared after the Fox Chamber was opened.

But wait, in Evidence 9, the Crime Photo, it's described that there are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood in the Fox Chamber. This indicates that these feathers and footprints were present at the crime scene, possibly before the Fox Chamber was opened.

So, there's a contradiction here. The testimony claims that the feathers and tracks weren't there before the Fox Chamber was opened, but the evidence shows that they were present in the Fox Chamber, which would imply they were there before it was opened.

Therefore, the pair that contradicts each other is Evidence 9 (Crime Photo) and Testimony 4 (L'Belle's statement about the feathers and tracks not being there before the Fox Chamber was opened).
</think>
